results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = number of arrangements of n indistinguishable balls in n boxes with the maximum number of balls in any box equal to k.
comment: To clarify a slight ambiguity in the definition, the heaviest box in such an arrangement should contain exactly k balls. - _Gus Wiseman_, Sep 22 2016
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..200, flattened (first 59 rows from R. H. Hardin)
formula: Empirical: right half of table, T(n,k) = n*binomial(2*n-k-2,n-2) for 2*k>n, also T(n,2 ) = sum{j=1..n} binomial(n,j)*binomial(n-j,j) = 2*A097861(n).
